cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (expected, currently Potential Tropical Cyclone)
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north across the west-central Gulf, forecast to reach the north-central Gulf Coast late Friday night/early Saturday, then arc northeast across the lower Mississippi Valley and Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Warning issued east of the port from Intracoastal City, LA to the AL/FL border including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Same as watch area – Intracoastal City LA to AL/FL border
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire north-central Gulf Coast from southwest Louisiana through coastal Mississippi, Alabama and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (4%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 25–35 kt possible late Friday night into Saturday morning
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation possible along the Cameron–Intracoastal City stretch, including Calcasieu Lake back into the port waterways
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with locally up to 12 inches possible Friday through early Saturday, posing flash-flood risk for port facilities and access roads
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Friday afternoon–Saturday; minor river rises and urban flooding could disrupt ground transportation and terminal operations
